title: Stop Confusing "Playing Badly" with "Trolling"
body:
A lot of people seem to think that because someone is playing badly they are trolling. They convince themselves it must be on purpose, and often they take it as a direct affront against them (thus they get toxic toward the other player).

NEWSFLASH: The world doesn't revolve around you. Matchmaking isn't perfect, and people have different skill levels. And everyone, regardless of skill, has bad games. Very, very few people intentionally play badly. And the few cases people DO intentionally play badly, they are likely provoked by someone being passive aggressive toward them for their previous un-intentional bad play. 

Trolling and having a bad game/being a bad player are not the same thing. Almost everyone who seems to think so (not coincidentally) have their own large share of mistakes as players, and would be better off focusing on improving themselves than trying to rationalize the bad play of others (by saying "oh they must be a troll").

And finally: you're matched with those braindead players. You're in the same game as them. So you're just as bad as them, on average. Don't look down on them because you feel superior, 'cause you're not.

> their would not be plats in diamond games, silvers in bronze games, golds in x games etc etc.

Three reasons, and none of them is "I'm wrong" or "You're right" (because I'm not, and you ain't):

One, it's the MMR that matters, not the displayed Ranked. This is most prominent after a season reset, but it's true all year long, there are always people who didn't grind enough and who are lower than they should, or people who took too long of a break and are not as good as they were, so their MMR doesn't correspond to their displayed rating.

Two, the longer you wait in queue, the wider the range of MMR the match-making will accept to find you a game faster. This is most prominent at high MMR or in the very depths of Bronze 5, but it can play a role for everyone if you play in the little hours of the morning.

Three, and most importantly, fucking premades. As of today, a Silver 5 is allowed to queue with a Gold 1. So you get Silvers in Gold games, and all the stupid stuff like that. It gets even worse if you factor the first point above: a Silver 5 *with a Bronze 2 MMR* is allowed to queue with a Gold 1 *with a Plat 4 MMR*. This is fucking ridiculous, and THAT is a good reason you should complain to Riot, because I am definitely NOT saying their system is perfect. Queuing restrictions should be based on MMR, not Rank. (And that's also a good argument to make MMR visible, not hidden as it currently is, while you're at it.)

But imagining a conspiracy to keep you down at a 50% winrate, by giving you "bad" team-mates on purpose when you're on win streak? That's just fucking stupid. That's bad business, that's bad for competition, that's bad on each and every account. Riot has not a single bloody reason to do that, and they are not doing that. That's as clear a fact as can be.
